content.title: Shikshashree Scheme
content.department: Backward Classes Welfare Department & Tribal Development Department
content.details: The scheme 'Shikshashree Scheme' was implemented by the Government of West Bengal during 2014-15 by merging the existing schemes of Book Grants & Maintenance Grants to provide financial assistance to Schedule Caste students studying in classes V to VIII. It aims to improve participation in Pre-matric stages and minimize the incidence of drop-out especially in the case of girl students.
benefits: Financial assistance through Bank Account only
Class V to VII students will receive ₹750/- per annum
Class VIII students will receive ₹800/- per annum
eligibility: Students should belong to Scheduled Caste
Students of classes V-VIII are eligible
Annual family income should not exceed Rs 2.5 lakhs
Only day scholars belonging to West Bengal can apply
Applicant should be a regular full-time student in a Government, Government-aided, or recognized school
Scholarship continues subject to good conduct and attendance
Applicant should not receive any other scholarship for the same period
Applicant must hold a bank account in a nationalized bank
Scholarships are available for only one year per class
content.application_process: Online application through the official website of the Backward Classes Welfare Department & Tribal Development Department, West Bengal.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide financial assistance to Schedule Caste students reading in classes V to VIII.

faqs.question: When was this scheme implemented?
faqs.answer: The scheme was implemented during the year 2014-15.

faqs.question: Which two schemes were merged under the 'Shikshashree Scheme'?
faqs.answer: Assistance in the form of book grant and assistance in the form of maintenance grant.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the scholarship will be provided to the students of Classes V to VIII.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the Schedule Caste category?
faqs.answer: Yes, only the students of the Schedule Caste category are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the class-wise rates of scholarship to be given to the eligible students?
faqs.answer: Students of class V to VII will receive ₹750/- per annum and students of class VIII will receive ₹800/- per annum.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a day scholar student?
faqs.answer: Yes, only day scholars belonging to West Bengal can apply for this scholarship.

faqs.question: What should be the family income?
faqs.answer: The family income should not be more than ₹2.5 lakhs per annum.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the student of government schools?
faqs.answer: No, regular full-time students in Government, Government-aided, and recognized schools in West Bengal are eligible.

faqs.question: Will the scholarship be continued up to class VIII?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scholarship will continue subject to subsequent application and eligibility.

faqs.question: Is a student getting any other scholarship or stipend for the same period eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the student should not receive any other scholarship for the same period.

faqs.question: Will the scholarship be continued if a student has failed?
faqs.answer: If a student has to repeat a class, they will not get a scholarship for that class for a second year.

faqs.question: How can I apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible students can apply online under the scheme.
